page.title: 01Northern Slope of Snowdon
page.content: This area consists of the land rising from 100 metres above sea level to 500 metres. The lower area consists of Llyn Peris, a lake which is used in a hydro-electric pump storage scheme by the CEGB; & a very small area of level land on which the residential part of Llanberis village lies. The higher land has recently seen changes; large scale fencing to contain sheep, & drainage of peat bogs to improve the pasture has taken place. Remote farm- houses & drystone walls are in dis- repair. Feral goats still roam at will in the planted mixed woodland & open mountain slopes. The increased number of mountain walkers has lead to substantial improvements in the footpaths. Over 400,000 walkers go part way up Snowdon annually!
